I strongly oppose the Trump administration’s overall tariff and trade policy, which usurps Congress’ constitutional authority, reverses generations of advancement toward fair and open international trade, punishes our allies, partners and friends, and is certainly raising costs for all Americans. But the other side of that coin with which I fully agree is that trade should be fair and we should not allow any country, especially the People’s Republic of China, to continue with unfair trade practices such as intellectual property theft, state subsidies to drive competitors out of business to create monopolies increasing prices, and on. I joined colleagues in introducing two measures to crack down on unfair trade practices.
